snippet: One of three men sentenced to life in prison for kidnapping and burying a busload of schoolchildren in 1976 for a $5 million ransom, was denied parole today in his 10th bid for freedom.    The decision by the state Board of Prison Terms was based ...
lead_paragraph: One of three men sentenced to life in prison for kidnapping and burying a busload of schoolchildren in 1976 for a $5 million ransom, was denied parole today in his 10th bid for freedom. The decision by the state Board of Prison Terms was based on the extreme gravity of the crime and a recent psychiatric evaluation noting that the man, Frederick N. Woods, had only recently accepted responsibility for the crime, said Denise Schmidt, a spokeswoman.
abstract: California Prison Terms Board again denies parole for Frederick N Woods, one of three men sentenced to life in prison for kidnapping and burying a busload of schoolchildren in 1976 for a $5 million ransom (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Chowchilla Kidnapper Denied 10th Parole Bid
